medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute respiratory distress syndrome due to vaseline oil intoxication.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient exhibited respiratory distress after using one or more 200-ml packs of vaseline oil per day, exceeding the maximal laxative dose of 45 ml/day. Admission to the intensive care unit occurred with an acute respiratory failure that improved over 20 days with steroid therapy but deteriorated again after tapering steroids.
medical_history.social_history: Patient uses vaseline oil daily for laxative purposes.
